result.execSummary:
The defendant Kody O. Cowley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery by Prisoners, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: any other sentence currently being served.

miscConds.notes:
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office. 

Assessment/Treatment/Counseling as recommended.

DNA sample;

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kody O. Cowley

records.addlTxt: w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Case Called: 10:03 am
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Lacey Coonen in person:
Defendant appears in custody, in person, and with Atty John Wallace in person;
VRCW. Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.
PLEA: 
Ct. 1 (Battery by Prisoners)>> GUILTY.
Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  

COURT ORDERS: 
Ct. 1 (Battery by Prisoners)>> Sentence W/H- 3 Years Probation, Concurrent with any other sentence currently being served. CONDITIONS: Assessment/treatment/counseling as recommended, No Contact with the Victim, Court Costs, DNA Sample and Surcharge. Court finds 221 Days Credit.

Adjourned: 10:08 am
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.

COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding; 
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, a factual basis & defendant guilty;

COURT ORDERS: 
20CM129 --
Ct.1>> SWH for 3 probation, to run CONCURRENT to each other; CONDITIONS:  Pay fine of $1492, inclusive of all costs. Serve 15 days MCJ, to run CONCURRENT with other jail sentence, with huber privileges for work/school/treatment or a combination;  No objection to EMP.  Any vehicle titled or registered in the Defendant's name is subject to IID installation for 13 months, as is the Defendant him/herself and device to be installed immediately;  IID installation fee to be paid.  13 months DL revocation with any administrative credit.  Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent. NO CONTACT with any of the named victims, their residences or their work places.  Maintain full time work/school or combination of the two. Maintain absolute sobriety. Provide DNA sample.  

20CM908 --
Ct.2>> SWH for 3 probation, to run CONCURRENT to each other; CONDITIONS: Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent. NO CONTACT with any of the named victims, their residences or their work places.  Maintain full time work/school or combination of the two. Maintain absolute sobriety. Pay CC/DA surcharge and DNA surcharge.  Provide DNA sample.  
Restitution has been requested, TBD within 60 days. 

21CF352 --
Ct.1>> SWH for 5 probation, to run CONCURRENT to each other; CONDITIONS:  Serve 1 year MCJ, to run CONCURRENT with other jail sentence, with huber privileges for work/school/treatment or a combination;  No objection to EMP. Maintain full time work/school or combination of the two. Maintain absolute sobriety. Pay CC surcharge and DNA surcharge.  Provide DNA sample.  
Court grants 122 days credit.

Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
